module.name: temperature
module.title: Temperature: Molecular Motion Made Perceptible
module.description: Temperature is average kinetic energy of molecules. Heat and cold. Thermal equilibrium. Third law: absolute zero unreachable. Felt through thermoception.

essence.geometric: Temperature = 0D point value (scalar) that can create 2D field (thermal gradients)
essence.physical: Average kinetic energy of molecular motion. T ∝ ⟨E_kinetic⟩
essence.experiential: Warmth and coldness. Comfort and discomfort. Energy flow through skin.
essence.consciousness: Thermoception's object. Direct sensation of energy exchange.
essence.thermodynamic: Measure of system's internal energy. Determines direction of heat flow.

absolute_zero.definition: Temperature at which molecular motion ceases (classically)
absolute_zero.third_law: Absolute zero unreachable in finite steps
absolute_zero.quantum: Even at 0 K, zero-point energy remains (ΔE ≥ ℏω/2)
absolute_zero.implications: Entropy → 0 as T → 0 (Third Law of Thermodynamics)

temperature.definition: Intensive property. Average kinetic energy per molecule.
temperature.property: Does not depend on amount of substance

heat.definition: Extensive property. Total thermal energy transferred.
heat.property: Depends on mass and temperature change

conduction.examples: Metal spoon in hot coffee, heat through wall

convection.examples: Boiling water, atmospheric circulation, radiator heating

radiation.mechanism: Electromagnetic waves carry energy (no medium needed)
radiation.examples: Sun heating Earth, infrared heaters, thermal cameras

zeroth_law.statement: If A in equilibrium with B, and B with C, then A with C

first_law.meaning: Change in internal energy = heat added - work done

second_law.statement: Entropy of isolated system never decreases
second_law.clausius: Heat flows hot → cold spontaneously, not reverse
second_law.carnot: No heat engine more efficient than Carnot engine
second_law.consequence: Arrow of time. Order → disorder naturally

third_law.implication: Perfect crystal at 0 K has zero entropy
third_law.consequence: Absolute zero unreachable in finite steps

liquid_gas.example: Water ↔ Steam at 100°C (373.15 K) at 1 atm

latent_heat.definition: Energy required for phase change at constant T
latent_heat.note: Temperature constant during phase transition despite energy input

perception_by_thermoception.detector: Thermoreceptors in skin and internal organs

adaptation.example: Water feels normal after initial shock

thermal_grill_illusion.note: Brain creates pain from conflicting signals

blackbody_radiation.wien_law: λ_max = b/T (peak wavelength inversely proportional to temperature)
blackbody_radiation.thermal_imaging: Cameras detect infrared radiation to see temperature

entropy_and_temperature.interpretation: Temperature = how entropy changes with energy
entropy_and_temperature.high_temp: Adding energy increases entropy a little (many states already accessible)
entropy_and_temperature.low_temp: Adding energy increases entropy a lot (few states accessible)
entropy_and_temperature.negative_temperature: Theoretically possible in special systems (population inversion)

quantum_effects.bose_einstein_condensate: Ultra-cold bosons occupy same quantum state
quantum_effects.superconductivity: Zero electrical resistance below critical temperature

energy_perception.principle: Temperature = direct feeling of molecular energy
energy_perception.embodied: Most immediate sense of energy exchange

cfo_integration.reason: Temperature = 0D scalar at point, but creates 2D gradient fields

coherence.gradient: Temperature difference = driving force for energy flow

applications.cooking: Precise temperature control for desired reactions
applications.energy: Heat engines, refrigeration, thermal power plants

subjective_warmth.question: Why does metal feel colder than wood at same temperature?
subjective_warmth.answer: Metal conducts heat away from skin faster (high k)
subjective_warmth.perception: We feel rate of heat loss, not temperature directly

fever_benefit.question: Why do we evolved fever response?
fever_benefit.hypothesis: Higher temperature inhibits pathogens, enhances immune response
fever_benefit.cost: Metabolically expensive, can cause damage if too high

heat_death.concept: Ultimate fate of universe = maximum entropy, uniform temperature
heat_death.implication: No temperature gradients = no energy flow = no work = no life

external.citation: Callen, H. B. (1985). Thermodynamics and an Introduction to Thermostatistics
Zemansky, M. W., & Dittman, R. H. (1997). Heat and Thermodynamics

meta.experience: Warmth and coldness at skin boundary
